definition: to annex/to take over/to acquire
double/twice/simultaneous/holding two or more (official) posts at the same time
and/furthermore/also/together with/(not) at all/simultaneously/to combine/to join/to merge
to combine/to amalgamate
variant of 並|并[bing4]
mergers and acquisitions (M&A)

sentences.english: Cash-starved companies welcome Chinese investment or acquisition offers.
sentences.chinese: 急需资金的公司欢迎中国的投资或兼并提议。

sentences.english: We made progress in enterprise mergers and reorganizations.
sentences.chinese: 企业兼并重组取得新进展。

sentences.english: The big company merged various small businesses.
sentences.chinese: 那家大公司兼并了多家小商行。

sentences.english: Further progress was made in mergers and reorganization in key industries.
sentences.chinese: 重点行业兼并重组取得新进展。

sentences.english: For the first time, it's poised to surpass both Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley in the lucrative M&A business.
sentences.chinese: 在兼并重组业务方面上它超过了高盛和摩根士丹利。

sentences.english: Acquistions of smaller companies by bigger companies are a fact of the business world.
sentences.chinese: 较大公司兼并较小公司是商业界中的事实。

sentences.english: Picture-taking is a technique both for annexing the objective world and for expressing the singular self.
sentences.chinese: 照相是一种既兼并客观世界，又表达独特自我的技术。

sentences.english: The small firms were absorbed into large cartels.
sentences.chinese: 这些小公司被大企业联盟兼并了。

sentences.english: Some consulting firms also offer computer programs to help mergers succeed.
sentences.chinese: 一些谘询公司还提供电脑程式，以帮助兼并成功。

sentences.english: Second, we will encourage mergers and reorganization of enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 二是促进企业兼并重组。

sentences.english: This sugar factory is one of the recent acquisitions of the company.
sentences.chinese: 这家糖厂是公司最近兼并的厂家之一。

sentences.english: The Galactic Empire inherited the technological achievements of both warring factions of the Clone Wars.
sentences.chinese: 银河帝国兼并了克隆人战争交战双方的技术成果。

sentences.english: Land annexation was a persistent ailment of the Ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 土地兼并是古代中国的一个顽症。

sentences.english: The development of Chinese enterprises has been entered into the new period of developing by the annex and recombination.
sentences.chinese: 中国企业的发展已进入了依靠兼并重组壮大的新时期。

sentences.english: In 2010, the company acquired Holland Darwin Mechanical and Electric Corporation.
sentences.chinese: 去年成功兼并了荷兰达尔文机电公司。

sentences.english: Shanxi coal mine massive mergers and acquisitions in real terms in step by step movement.
sentences.chinese: 声势浩大的山西煤矿兼并重组运动迈出实质一步。

definition: to annex
to unify/unified
Vertical and Horizontal Alliance, opposing stratagems devised by the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
to swallow up/to annex/to merge
to attack/to raid/(of medicine) potent
to set up an independent regime/to secede/segmentation/division/fragmentation
expansion/dilation/to expand (e.g. one's power or influence)/to broaden
to incorporate into one's troops/to weave in
lit. hunting deer in the Central Plain (idiom)/fig. to attempt to seize the throne
to contend for supremacy
to form an alliance/to ally oneself with/allied with/aligned/to bond with
internal strife/power struggle/(of members of an organization) to fight each other
to go on or send a punitive expedition
internal disorder/civil strife/civil unrest
to dispute
the task of establishing and maintaining hegemony
